query: Describe in detail the full safety procedure for cleaning the AM400 build chamber after a print job, including personal protective equipment, powder handling, chamber venting, and waste disposal.
answer: To clean the AM400 build chamber after a print job, first ensure the chamber is vented to atmospheric pressure. Wear all required personal protective equipment, including gloves, laboratory coat, and safety goggles. Handle any remaining metal powder with care, using approved tools to avoid spills. Collect residual powder for reuse or dispose of it in accordance with local safety regulations. Clean all chamber surfaces with appropriate cleaning agents. Dispose of all waste and cleaning materials safely, and record the cleaning activity in the maintenance log.

query: Detail all required steps for preparing the AM400 for a new material, including powder removal, cleaning, safety checks, and record keeping.
answer: To prepare the AM400 for a new material: (1) Completely empty the powder silo of the old powder, collecting all residual material. (2) Thoroughly clean the powder silo, build chamber, and all powder handling tools to remove all traces of the previous powder, following cleaning agent recommendations. (3) Inspect and clean the build platform and recoater mechanism. (4) Verify that all personal protective equipment is used during cleaning. (5) Dispose of old powder and cleaning waste according to regulations. (6) Refill the powder silo with the new material, ensuring no contamination. (7) Perform all safety checks, including interlock, oxygen level, and inert gas supply verification. (8) Log the material change, cleaning steps, and checks in the maintenance and material records.

query: Explain the complete shutdown and post-processing workflow after a print job is finished, including chamber venting, powder recovery, part removal, cleaning, maintenance checks, and documentation.
